title: Reflexive-transitive closure as an indexed union

blocks.name: crtrcl
blocks.content: Extend class notation with recursively defined reflexive, transitive closure.

blocks.name: df-rtrclrec
blocks.content: The reflexive, transitive closure of a relation constructed as the union of all finite exponentiations. (Contributed by Drahflow, 12-Nov-2015.)

blocks.name: dfrtrclrec2
blocks.content: If two elements are connected by a reflexive, transitive closure, then they are connected via ` n ` instances the relation, for some ` n ` . (Contributed by Drahflow, 12-Nov-2015.)

  sylancl(w0, wceq(cfv(cmpt(hs0, universe, ciun(s0, cn0, co(cv(hs0), crelexp, cv(s0)))), c1), ciun(s0, cn0, co(c1, crelexp, cv(s0)))), wcel(c1, universe), wcel(ciun(s0, cn0, co(c1, crelexp, cv(s0))), universe))

  3bitr4g(w0, wbr(c0, ciun(s0, cn0, co(c1, crelexp, cv(s0))), c2), wrex(s0, cn0, wbr(c0, co(c1, crelexp, cv(s0)), c2)), wcel(cop(c0, c2), ciun(s0, cn0, co(c1, crelexp, cv(s0)))), wrex(s0, cn0, wcel(cop(c0, c2), co(c1, crelexp, cv(s0)))))

  iuneq2d(hs1, cn0, co(cv(hs0), crelexp, cv(hs1)), co(c0, crelexp, cv(hs1)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))

  sseqtr4d((= |` ⋃ ⋃ c0), ((hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ ⋃(hs1 ∈ ℕ0,(hs0[^r]hs1)))` c0), ⋃(hs1 ∈ ℕ0,(c0[^r]hs1)), w0)
  syl(w0, (= |` ⋃ ⋃ c0)⊆ ⋃(hs1 ∈ ℕ0,(c0[^r]hs1)), ∃(hs1 ∈ ℕ0,(= |` ⋃ ⋃ c0)⊆(c0[^r]hs1)))

  0nn0()
  syl5sseqr((= |` ⋃ ⋃ c0), (c0[^r]0), (= |` ⋃ ⋃ c0), w0)
  ssid((= |` ⋃ ⋃ c0))
  relexp0d(c0, w0)
  rspcev(hs1, nat0, cn0, (= |` ⋃ ⋃ c0)⊆(c0[^r]0), (= |` ⋃ ⋃ c0)⊆(c0[^r]hs1))
  sseq2d((= |` ⋃ ⋃ c0), (c0[^r]hs1), (c0[^r]0), hs1 = 0)
  oveq2(hs1, nat0, c0, crelexp)
  ssiun(hs1, cn0, (= |` ⋃ ⋃ c0), (c0[^r]hs1))
  sylancl(w0, ((hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ ⋃(hs1 ∈ ℕ0,(hs0[^r]hs1)))` c0)= ⋃(hs1 ∈ ℕ0,(c0[^r]hs1)), c0 ∈ 𝕌, ⋃(hs1 ∈ ℕ0,(c0[^r]hs1))∈ 𝕌)
  iunex(hs1, cn0, (c0[^r]hs1))
  nn0ex()
  ovex(c0, crelexp, hs1)
  fvmptg(hs0, c0, universe, ⋃(hs1 ∈ ℕ0,(c0[^r]hs1)), universe, (hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ ⋃(hs1 ∈ ℕ0,(hs0[^r]hs1))), ⋃(hs1 ∈ ℕ0,(hs0[^r]hs1)))
  iuneq2d(hs1, cn0, (hs0[^r]hs1), (c0[^r]hs1), hs0 = c0)
  oveq1(hs0, c0, crelexp, hs1)
  eqid((hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ ⋃(hs1 ∈ ℕ0,(hs0[^r]hs1))))
  ax-mp(((w0 →(= |` ⋃ ⋃ c0)⊆(t*rec ` c0))↔(w0 →(= |` ⋃ ⋃ c0)⊆((hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ ⋃(hs1 ∈ ℕ0,(hs0[^r]hs1)))` c0))), t*rec =(hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ ⋃(hs1 ∈ ℕ0,(hs0[^r]hs1))))
  df-rtrclrec(hs0, hs1)
  imbi2d(t*rec =(hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ ⋃(hs1 ∈ ℕ0,(hs0[^r]hs1))), w0, (= |` ⋃ ⋃ c0)⊆(t*rec ` c0), (= |` ⋃ ⋃ c0)⊆((hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ ⋃(hs1 ∈ ℕ0,(hs0[^r]hs1)))` c0))
  sseq2d((= |` ⋃ ⋃ c0), (t*rec ` c0), ((hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ ⋃(hs1 ∈ ℕ0,(hs0[^r]hs1)))` c0), t*rec =(hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ ⋃(hs1 ∈ ℕ0,(hs0[^r]hs1))))
  fveq1(crtrcl, (hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ ⋃(hs1 ∈ ℕ0,(hs0[^r]hs1))), c0)

blocks.name: rtrclreclem4
blocks.content: The reflexive, transitive closure of ` R ` is the smallest reflexive, transitive relation which contains ` R ` and the identity. (Contributed by Drahflow, 12-Nov-2015.) (Revised by RP, 30-May-2020.)
